div.div: Please take a look at our school closure resource page for information (as it becomes available) about the effects of the Safer At Home order on our schools.
Beginning Wednesday, March 18, KASD and Chartwells will be making meals available to our students.
In an effort to create a continuity of learning, KASD has developed a page of resources for families and students to use during our school closure.

a.title: 3:30 PM - Policy Committee

div.p: Thank you to everyone who submitted a question or concern using our online form. We have read through all of the questions, and addressed each of them in an online FAQ document that you can find on our website. For some questions, we don't yet have answers, but we are working on developing plans to meet the needs of all of our students and families. More information will be released soon and this document will be updated regularly. If you have additional questions, please don't hesitate to submit them to the form here: https://forms.gle/HiBNiwH8q9RuXhqX8.

First and foremost, we hope that you and your family are doing as well as possible during this challenging time. This afternoon, April 16, 2020, Governor Evers directed the Wisconsin Department of Health Services to extend the Safer at Home order through May 26; sadly, the extension means that our school buildings will not reopen for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. You can find additional information in this evening's communication from Superintendent Duerwaechter. We will continue to do our very best to support our students' needs. As always, we appreciate your patience and understanding as we work through the next several weeks. We will get through this together; we will stay#StrongAtHomeand work#StrongerTogether.

Kaukauna Area School District has been recognized as one of the Best Communities for Music Education by the NAMM Foundation. The award is presented to Districts nationwide for their outstanding commitment to providing music access and education to students, and recognizes the outstanding efforts by teachers, administrators, parents, students and community leaders who have made music education part of a well-rounded education. Read more here.

Four KASD Educators have been recognized as 2020 Educators of Promise by the Wisconsin Department of Public Instruction, in collaboration with the Wisconsin Army National Guard, and the Wisconsin Association for Middle Level Education. Read more here.

We are excited to announce that beginning Friday, April 3, we will be expanding this distribution to include breakfasts and lunches for the weekend as well. This means that each Friday, we will hand out 3 breakfasts and 3 lunches to anyone who arrives at our pickup location.

Effective March 24, and until further notice, all KASD school buildings areclosed to the public, which includes KASD's District Office. Per the most recent order from the Governor's office, we will no longer be offering in-person office hours.Our District Office staff will still be available via phone or email Monday through Friday from 7:30 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. If you need to speak with someone, please call (920) 759-6109,or contact us via email using the contact form on the websiteor sending an email tocontactkasd@kaukaunasd.org. Thank you for your understanding.

KASD has created a page on our website to provide continuous updates and information about how our schools and events are affected, how to talk to your students, and different everyday prevention methods.
Do you know a student or staff member that's done something great? Share your Kaukauna Strong news with us here.
Looking for more district news? You can find our archives from all district news stories and sign up for alerts here!

div.div:
The Kaukauna Area School District is committed to meeting accessibility requirements and making information available in accordance with the American with Disabilities Act (ADA) and Section 508. The website and pages within are regularly monitored and updated to provide an accessible and friendly user experience. If you have additional questions, please view our full disclaimer
© 2020 Kaukauna Area School District. All Rights Reserved.
